question: According to Le Chatelierâ€™s principle, in the reaction CO(g) + 3H2(g) <=> CH4(g) + H2O(g), the formation of methane is favoured by
(a) Increasing the concentration of CO
(b) Increasing the concentration of H2O
(c) Decreasing the concentration of CH4
(d) Decreasing the concentration of H2
explanation: Forward reaction (formation of methane) is favored by increasing reactants (CO) or removing products (CH4) [cite: 1021-1022].
